mini1

Class Projectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • mini1.Projectile

  • public class Projectile
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates information about the position and velocity of a projectile in two dimensions. A projectile also has a size that can be used to determine collisions with other projectiles based on a bounding box, assumed to be a size x size rectangle with its upper left corner at the projectile's position. The horizontal and vertical components of the velocity represent the change in horizontal and vertical position, respectively, per time unit. The method timeStep simulates the passage of one time unit, updating the position by adding the velocity components to the corresponding position components, and adding the optional gravity parameter to the y-component of the velocity. A projectile also has a status of alive or dead that applications may set or check using the methods kill() and isAlive(). The "dead" status has no effect on any method other than isAlive().

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Projectile(double initialPositionX, double initialPositionY, double initialVelocityX, double initialVelocityY, int givenSize)
      Constructs a projectile with the given position, velocity, and size that is initially alive and has age 0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean collides(Projectile givenProjectile)
      Determines whether this projectile's bounding box intersects with the given projectile's bounding box, according to the intersects() method of java.awt.Rectangle.
      int getAge()
      Returns the number of times that timeStep has been called on this projectile (regardless of whether it is marked or unmarked).
      java.awt.Rectangle getBoundingBox()
      Returns the bounding box for this projectile as a new instance of java.awt.Rectangle.
      double getVelocityX()
      Returns the horizontal component of this projectile's velocity.
      double getVelocityY()
      Returns the vertical component of this projectile's velocity.
      double getX()
      Returns this projectile's horizontal position.
      double getY()
      Returns this projectile's vertical position.
      boolean isAlive()
      Determines whether this projectile's status is "alive".
      void kill()
      Marks this projectile as "dead".
      void timeStep()
      Simulates motion over one time step.
      void timeStep(double gravity)
      Simulates motion over one time step.

      • Projectile

        public Projectile(double initialPositionX,
                  double initialPositionY,
                  double initialVelocityX,
                  double initialVelocityY,
                  int givenSize)
        Constructs a projectile with the given position, velocity, and size that is initially alive and has age 0
        Parameters:
        initialPositionX - the original position on the "X" axis
        initialPositionY - the original position on the "Y" axis
        initialVelocityX - the original speed and direction on the "X" axis
        initialVelocityY - the original speed and direction on the "X" axis
        givenSize - the size of the projectile's square sides

      • collides

        public boolean collides(Projectile givenProjectile)
        Determines whether this projectile's bounding box intersects with the given projectile's bounding box, according to the intersects() method of java.awt.Rectangle.
        Parameters:
        givenProjectile - the projectile to test a collision with
        Returns:
        True means there is a collision and false means there isn't
